co.paralleluniverse.data.record

Class RecordType<R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.paralleluniverse.data.record.RecordType<R>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SealedRecordType<R>

    public class RecordType<R>
extends Object
implements SealedRecordType<R>
    Represents a record type, and includes a name, and a list of fields along with their names and types.

    A new record type must be declared as a static member of a class. The class must only include the definition of a single record type, and this class is called the type's identifier class, because it is used only to uniquely identify the record type (only its name is used internally).

    Here's an example record type definition: ```java class A { public static final RecordType aType = RecordType.newType(A.class); public static final IntField $id = stateType.intField("id"); public static final DoubleField $foo = stateType.doubleField("id", Field.TRANSIENT); public static final ObjectField $name = stateType.objectField("name", String.class); public static final ObjectField> $emails = stateType.objectField("emails", new TypeToken() {}); } ``` A is the type's identifier class. The fields are instances of Field and are, by convention, given identifiers that begin with a \$ to make it clear that they identify fields rather than values.
    A new record is instantiated by calling one of the newInstance methods.

        public RecordType(Class<R> type,

        Parameters:
        type - the identifier class of this record type.
        parent - the super-type of this type (may be null).

      • isInstance

        public boolean isInstance(Record<?> record)
        Test's whether a record is an instance of this type (or one of its subtypes).
        Specified by:
        isInstance in interface SealedRecordType<R>
        Parameters:
        record - the record to test
        Returns:
        true if record is an instance of this type (or one of its subtypes); false otherwise.

      • newInstance

        public Record<R> newInstance()
        Creates an new record instance of this type. The returned implementation stores the record in an efficient memory representation.
        Specified by:
        newInstance in interface SealedRecordType<R>
        Returns:
        a newly constructed record of this type.

      • wrap

        public Record<R> wrap(Object target)
        Wraps a given object with a record instance of this type. The record's fields are mapped to the target's fields or getters/setters of the same name. Changes to the record will be reflected in the target object and vice versa.

        The record's implementation RecordType.Mode mode will be the best (fastest) one available for the target's class.

        Specified by:
        wrap in interface SealedRecordType<R>
        Parameters:
        target - the POJO to wrap as a record
        Returns:
        a newly constructed record of this type, which reflects target.

      • wrap

        public Record<R> wrap(Object target,
                      RecordType.Mode mode)
        Wraps a given object with a record instance of this type. The record's fields are mapped to the target's fields or getters/setters of the same name. Changes to the record will be reflected in the target object and vice versa.
        Specified by:
        wrap in interface SealedRecordType<R>
        Parameters:
        target - the POJO to wrap as a record
        mode - the record's implementation RecordType.Mode mode.
        Returns:
        a newly constructed record of this type, which reflects target.

      • newArray

        public RecordArray<R> newArray(int size)
        Creates an new RecordArray instance of this type. The returned implementation stores the record array in an efficient memory representation.
        Specified by:
        newArray in interface SealedRecordType<R>
        Returns:
        a newly constructed record array of this type.
